content.description:
To the left of the corner of the boulder where it trends uphill. Find the low/mid face, right facing small jugs. Above them at a distance will be a nice flat sloper. 

  Start low on those jugs and paste feet on nothing for a tension dyno up to the flat sloper. From there, hit the top lip and locate the crimp seam. Make use of the seam to press out a crux top out.

On the corner arÃªte where the boulders face trends back uphill, find the long jug side-pull rail feature that runs long ways up the blunt corner from bottom to top. 

  Start as low as possible and use the features to scale the corner to the knobby top out.

Black Mamba is a short, steep, and long boulder located up on the hillside and to the right from Title Fight. 

  This boulder is positioned in a drainage, so bring a brush as it tends to collect some grit after periods of rainfall. 

  The face stretches on for about 40 feet, but the top of the boulder is only 8-9 feet tall followed by a (usually) tricky full press top out.
